website_summaries.verdict: A CVT fluid that is specifically formulated for today's state-of-the-art variable transmissions.
pros: Formulated with premium synthetic base stocks, long-life friction modifiers, special anti-wear additives, and shear stable viscosity modifiers
Delivers superior wet clutch and anti-wear performance
Works great in most belt and chain-driven CV transmissions
cons: Not recommended for use in Toyota and Ford hybrid transmissions

customer_reviews.title: USE IN 2015 HONDA
customer_reviews.text: Honda makes a big deal about only using Honda CVT fluid in their newer Honda. I used the Valvoline at 30,000 and it has worked fine. I now have 75,000 on the car and have had no problems so I just bought more Valvoline to change the oil again.
customer_reviews.author: Tim T.

customer_reviews.title: Might Not Compatible With All Vehicles...
customer_reviews.text: 'Replace the CVT Fluid in my 2010 Sentra SR and the car ran fine for about 12K miles then, began over-revving on upgrades and while slowing to stop. I have since replaced this fluid with the Nissan OEM NS-2 fluid and the over-rev condition cleared up and the car runs normal again and is now much quieter. I'll only use the recommended fluid from here on especially since the CVT factory warranty is extended to 120K.
customer_reviews.author: Dan-O

customer_reviews.title: Works great in my 09 Nissan Maxima
customer_reviews.text: Easier than changing the oil since there is no filter to remove! Certified to be compatible with NS-2 requirements for CVT fluid, so Nissan cannot reject a CVT warranty claim by you not using their Nissan brand CVT fluid. My car shifts smoother and idles at lower rpm now, I can tell there is a difference for sure, and it feels good to know I have good clean fluid in there. Fellow 7th gen maxima owners, follow this tutorial [...]
customer_reviews.author: Josh K.

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Truthfully, I've noticed no difference. At 100K miles I thought that it'd be a good idea to change it anyway. We've never abused the transmission so the oil that was drained didn't look "off". Trans seems to operate like it always has so all is good. I've used Valvoline motor oil exclusively and have had zero engine problems. No reason not to trust this. My only complaint is that this is some evil smelling stuff. If it wasn't synthetic, I'd say it was made from some pretty sick dinos.
customer_reviews.author: ratcherfratcher

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and affordable alternative to the dealer spec fluid
customer_reviews.text: Saved a lot of money buying it from Amazon versus the store. Ford wanted $15 a quart for non-synthetic CVT fluid to change out in my Ford Freestyle. So I saw this as a win-win. I'd recommend to anyone that needs CVT fluid within these specifications. *UPDATE 9-30-14* I am very happy with this purchase. I thought it was just a placebo effect when I changed out the fluid and tranny filter on my '07 Freestyle, but the fact is that the shifting/RPM's under load (like down an on-ramp) is far smoother than it used to be. I attribute this to both the fluid and the filter change at 150,000 miles in my Freestyle.
customer_reviews.author: Donny

customer_reviews.title: Might receive a different product than one shown.
customer_reviews.text: Got sent a different product than the one shown !! Obviously both for CVT transmissions, but the one in picture is recommended for Toyotas, however the one I was sent wasnt recommend for Toyotas 🤦‍♂️🤦‍♂️ Placed a picture of what they sent me. Might still work for yah either way but cant use the one they sent me, I was thinking I will receive the one shown on picture which clearly states for Toyotas.
customer_reviews.author: Omar Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Will be buying some more in 40000 miles
customer_reviews.text: Has a strong smell when fresh and not enough color to see it on the dipstick. But it shifts smooth and it seems to be a bit quieter. One of the easiest preventive maintenance jobs to do and will hopefully add alot of life to the trans.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin MacDowell

customer_reviews.title: Hi every one. I recently changed my transmission on ...
customer_reviews.text: Hi every one . I recently changed my transmission on 2013 Nissan Altima 4 cylinder . I both one from junk yard and installed with my relative . And put 5 quart of this oil cause didn't know how much i need add. Then when i took car to reprogram it to dealer they put 3 more original Nissans trans fluid. I already drove 1000 miles . I have no problem yet thanks God.
customer_reviews.author: Farrukh Muhammad

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff
customer_reviews.text: My 2008 Nissan Sentra CVT was making a horrible whining noise and I thought that the transmission was on its last legs. I did 2 fluid changes per YouTube videos and now the noise is gone and it seems to run a lot smoother. I highly recommend this fluid. However, this stuff has a very nasty smell so be careful. I spilled some on my shoes and I had to throw them away due to the terrible smell.
customer_reviews.author: STM

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be what my Nissan Altima was needing  at a lower cost then
customer_reviews.text: I used this to change my CVT transmission fluid on my 2017 Nissan Altima, and haven’t had any negative issues after 10,000 miles. The only down side is only 3.6 quarts came out of my car at time of removal, which means I have too much extra sitting on a shelf. But yes... very nice... very nice.
customer_reviews.author: jason gleim

customer_reviews.title: worked well in the subaru
customer_reviews.text: worked well in the Subaru and was MUCH less than Subaru CVT fluid
customer_reviews.author: Thorny

customer_reviews.title: Works great on both my CVT transmissions. (Nissan Rogue and Nissan Altima)
customer_reviews.text: Works great on both my CVT transmissions. (Nissan Rogue and Nissan Altima) Seemed to be the least expensive I could find, and yet a brand name with a good reputation.
customer_reviews.author: RayJayTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: This item is intentionally advertised falsely
customer_reviews.text: This product clearly shows the item is posted as a case , I only received 1quart and was charged 19.95, it is posted for $10.40 a quart, so not only did I not receive an entire case I had to pay double what it shows on the site
customer_reviews.author: Michael hankins

customer_reviews.title: This is the good stuff. Been using it in my Mitsubishi Outlander ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the good stuff. Been using it in my Mitsubishi Outlander now for over 70k miles.
customer_reviews.author: EasTexSteveTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: Get a A+ rating  From me.
customer_reviews.text: It works as advertised. Valvoline is a name you can trust. And so far I've put on 8k miles with no problem. Nissan Dealer wants $280 to do a complete drain and refill.( I DONT THINK SO) I live in the south and traveling in 98+ degree weather makes my Nissan CVT whine. did this tranny fluid change myself and it stopped. but overall I would NEVER purchase a car with a CVT again.
customer_reviews.author: J.H

customer_reviews.title: It is a CVT30 and it performs as well or better than motorcraft and is a great value
customer_reviews.text: Do not be afraid to use this product. I used this in my wife's Ford five Hundred 2006. It is a CVT30 and it performs as well or better than motorcraft and is a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Works as specified.
customer_reviews.text: 2014 Subaru Crosstrek cvt fluid changed with this valvoline fluid instead of the Subaru and saved almost $5 a bottle. Only disadvantage was this fluid has a very strong odor compared to the oem Subaru fluid.
customer_reviews.author: Jen Webber

customer_reviews.title: Used in my 2007 Nissan Altima SE 3.5L! Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Used in my 2007 Nissan Altima SE 3.5L! Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Brown

customer_reviews.title: 2004 Mini Cooper
customer_reviews.text: Used this with a trans filter replacement. 5k miles on it so far with in city driving and long trips through the mountains. No problems!
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Measure how much you take out of your transmission
customer_reviews.text: I love the liquids is a lot easier in the fluid for transmission shifts better especially in Florida 2016 Nissan Altima
customer_reviews.author: Paul Dupree

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than the NS-2 oil from the dealership, no problem 20k+ miles later
customer_reviews.text: I had my CVT transmission going out on my 08 Nissan Altima at around 90k miles. They did a rebuild of some sort under warranty thank god. I then changed oil used this at around 130k miles. I'm currently at 152k and no problems.... fingers crossed.
customer_reviews.author: roll cyclones

customer_reviews.title: No issues, smoother acceleration.
customer_reviews.text: Works great in my 2008 Lancer ES. I noticed a smoother acceleration after coasting. Before changing the oil I was feeling a slight jolt when resuming acceleration after coasting. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used in my 2012 Subaru Impreza CVT will no ill ...
customer_reviews.text: Used in my 2012 Subaru Impreza CVT will no ill effects. Took all six to fill, you may need an extra quart depending on how much you get out.
customer_reviews.author: Orange606

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't tell any difference after replacing the fluid which I guess is a good thing.
customer_reviews.text: I gave my 08 Versa it's first CVT fluid change at 163k miles earlier this year. I'm up to around 175k miles with the Valvoline fluid now with no problems to report. For what it's worth, I couldn't tell any difference after replacing the fluid which I guess is a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: JustPassingBy

customer_reviews.title: smooth
customer_reviews.text: works great for my nissan. at this price I'll keep buying valvoline. transmission feels smooth again.
customer_reviews.author: Zeke G.

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two cases of 6 quarts each synthetic CVT fluid for a total price of $56.65. I received a total of TWO QUARTS. The final price was over 28 dollars a quart!
customer_reviews.author: wmkfoyxtlrdse

customer_reviews.title: I have used this product for a couple of years ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product for a couple of years and 60k miles on my 2013 Subaru Outback. Works as well as OEM fluid at a fraction of the price.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Works in my Freestyle
customer_reviews.text: Using it to try to extend the life of my Freestyle's CVT because no one will buy it!
customer_reviews.author: George Q

customer_reviews.title: Great CVT fluid at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Works well in our 2006 Murano. Valvoline makes top quality transmission fluid. There's no reason to pay more at the dealer.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Work great so far in the 2009 nissan altima and way cheaper than nissan fluid and looks the same.
customer_reviews.author: Hardie

customer_reviews.title: I already did 2 drain and fill with Valvoline CVT fluid and the transmission is as good as new
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my Nissan Juke that requires NS-2 fluid. I already did 2 drain and fill with Valvoline CVT fluid and the transmission is as good as new. I think I actually get more torque now.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Is working perfect in my Nissan Murano CVT transmission. I have 110,000 miles on it and going strong

customer_reviews.title: Nissan
customer_reviews.text: Valvoline cvt atf is by far the best atf fluid for your cvt transmission

customer_reviews.title: worked good much less then going to dealer for this oil
customer_reviews.text: worked good much less then going to dealer for this oil, and much better priced I will get this every time i change the CVT.

customer_reviews.title: Nice stuff
customer_reviews.text: Replaced factory fluid in 2012 Jeep Patriot, working great, shifts smooth and quietly, less expensive than MOPAR brand.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for Mitsubishi Lancer 2008 CVT, its just took 20 minutes chage the CVT oil.

customer_reviews.title: Works good so far.
customer_reviews.text: Drained 2011 Nissan Rogue at 144k miles. Added 7 quarts of CVT fluid. Transmission shifts great. There is no filter in the Rogue.

customer_reviews.title: This product was awesome and half the cost of OEM recommended fluid
customer_reviews.text: This product was awesome and half the cost of OEM recommended fluid. The car seems to take off better and smoother very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Reedy

customer_reviews.title: Match CVT
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Great price. OEM match. Shifts smoothly now. Amazing what new fluids can do for an high mileage Audi Allroad.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great in Jeep CVT
customer_reviews.text: Working great in my Jeep Patriot with a CVT. HALF the cost of the Mopar oil.

customer_reviews.title: Original product arrived fast.
customer_reviews.text: Great price and original quality. Would buy again for Jeep Compass.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Smooth performing fluid. Caused no issues while replacing Nissan CVT fluid with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: worked great in my 07 Audi a6 s-line with cvt.
customer_reviews.author: Clint Goulet

customer_reviews.title: Nissan Altima has been running great.
customer_reviews.text: Expensive stuff but...gotta have it. Nissan Altima has been running great.
customer_reviews.author: James T. Pickelsimer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Brand at a GREAT PRICE! Have a Nissan Cube and this is working well in the transmission.
customer_reviews.author: HFS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Replacement to Nissan NS2
customer_reviews.text: Works great on my 2008 Nissan Rogue with 101K miles on the odometer. Flushed out 10 quart of old fluid through the transmission cooler hose while replenishing with this Valvoline CVT fluid. Car is more quiet and idles on lower RPM. This is a good, if not better, replacement to the more expensive Nissan brand NS-2 fluid. I have confirmed that there is no issue after replacing the entire CVT fluid in my transmission with this Valvoline CVT fluid. Thanks Amazon for the great price. I have done a full flush and fill for less than $100 and I know it was done right.
customer_reviews.author: J L

customer_reviews.title: works just as good a the OEM
customer_reviews.text: I used this for my 2012 Nissan Altima SR3.5, works just as good a the OEM, with half the cost.
customer_reviews.author: TN

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement for NS-2
customer_reviews.text: Just want to give a thumbs up after 700 miles on this new fluid. My 2007 Nissan Maxima manufacture warranty expired (passed10 years 96K miles). I decided to replace the very dirty dark original fluid with new fluid. Chose this more affordable Valvoline CVT fluid instead of the Nissan NS-2. I purchased 12 quarters. Flushed (cycled) out 11.5 quarters of the fluid (save half quarter for refill just in case) by following procedures learned from Youtube. It has been running very smoothly on the new fluid. I will probably flush it more frequently when it gets dark (dirty) every 30K or 40K miles in hope to extend my car's life to infinite. Let's see how long it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Tang&Tai

customer_reviews.title: Works-2012 Nissan Altima
customer_reviews.text: I have driven about 3000 miles since I did a complete fluid flush in my 2012 Nissan Altima (2.5 SL) and it is working just fine. I ordered 12 quarts did a complete drain and fill followed by flushing the rest of the old fluid out through the transmission cooling hose. Plenty of Youtube videos out there on the process. I still have almost 4 quarts left so I will definitely order more for my next transmission service.
customer_reviews.author: Mike W

customer_reviews.title: Great in Subaru CVT
customer_reviews.text: Works great in Subaru CVT. Provides transmission with a firm and strong pull
customer_reviews.author: C Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Stopped transmission whining.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2008 Mitsubishi Lancer GT and the transmission was whining. It had 150,000 miles without the CVT oil ever being changed. As soon as I changed it the whining stopped and the shift ratios improved; giving the car more power. Old oil cannot cool the transmission properly; which results in whining.
customer_reviews.author: Aurelio Torres Laster

customer_reviews.title: So far so good...
customer_reviews.text: Just put it in my 2011 Altima SR with the 3.5L V6. So far so good but its only been about 100 miles. I will update if any issues arise. Update 5/23/2016: 9k miles later and no issues. Update: 2/7/2017: No issues. I think I'm at about 15k miles since using it.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Works for nissan sentra 2007
customer_reviews.text: Used for my nissan sentra 2007. The car is running great.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Received this six quart case very fast. It's exactly what is described as the product your getting

customer_reviews.title: Ford Freestyle AWD 2005 Works well.
customer_reviews.text: From March 2016 I've been replacing in my Ford Freestyle 2005 AWD 145k miles , 1qt. each month and it is working very well. I never changed all the fluid only 1 qt. each month to try to extend the life of my vehicle. After 18 months you can replace all the fluid and the filter. This is a tip from my mechanic.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and better alternative than using Ford motorcraft non syntheic fluid
customer_reviews.text: I did research and compared the Ford Motor-craft non synthetic fluid vs several brands with synthetic as well as Valvoline is well known branded as well at that price Amazon offered six qt in case with free shipping. I saved at least more than $25 by using them than going to local store as well as saved some gas not driving down to the local store. I have been driving with this new fluid changes more than 1,000 mileage and can feel difference and more smooth in my transmission. My Ford has about 165k original miles transmission. I would buy it again !
customer_reviews.author: Marc A Perlman

product_meta.title: Valvoline CVT Full Synthetic Continuously Variable Transmission Fluid 1 QT, Case of 6
product_meta.description: Style:CVT| Size:1 Quart, Case of 6| Configuration:CVTValvoline CVT (Continuously Variable Transmission) Fluid is specifically formulated for today’s technologically sophisticated variable transmissions. It is formulated with premium synthetic base stocks, long-life friction modifiers, special anti-wear additives, and shear stable viscosity modifiers. Valvoline CVT Fluid is recommended for use in most belt and chain-driven continuously variable transmissions and will not void new car warranties. Valvoline CVT Fluid in not recommended for Hybrid CVT units (Toyota and Ford)
feature_bullets: Formulated with full-synthetic base stocks and advanced additive technology to meet the challenging demands of CVT transmissions
Excellent metal-to-metal protection and anti-shudder performance
Developed with anti-wear technology to help improve transmission durability
Engineered with a proprietary blend of base oils and advanced additives to provide better oil flow at low temperatures and greater film protection at higher temperatures

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars2,160 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
